query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Di nova pena mi conven far versi 2 e dar matera al ventesimo canto 3 de la prima canzon, ch’è d’i sommersi.
query.error: **English:** 1 Of new pain I must make verses 2 and give material to the twentieth canto 3 of the first canzon, which is of those submerged.
query.result: 1 A-dro dhe ben nowyth vydhfen gerow 2 ha rei mater dhe'n ugansves cans 3 a'n kynsa kenson, a wra a'n beudhis.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 Io era già disposto tutto quanto 5 a riguardar ne lo scoperto fondo, 6 che si bagnava d’angoscioso pianto;
query.error: **English:** 4 I was already completely ready 5 to look down into the revealed abyss, 6 which was bathed in anguished tears;
query.result: 4 O vyth ow disposya oll oll 5 rag gwelan y'n an fond a veu dhiskwedhys, 6 a veu bashes gans plenow angos.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 e vidi gente per lo vallon tondo 8 venir, tacendo e lagrimando, al passo 9 che fanno le letane in questo mondo.
query.error: **English:** 7 and I saw people coming through the round valley, 8 silently and weeping, at the pace 9 that the litanies are said in this world.
query.result: 7 Ha'm gwelas pobel dre'n val tondo 8 ow tos, ow tewa ha ow gul, dhe'n fordh 9 a wra gwres an letani y'n an bys ma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Come ’l viso mi scese in lor più basso, 11 mirabilmente apparve esser travolto 12 ciascun tra ’l mento e ’l principio del casso,
query.error: **English:** 10 As my gaze descended lower among them, 11 it appeared, marvellously, that each one was turned around 12 between the chin and the beginning of the chest,
query.result: 10 Pan wrug an golwg dhe'n ef dhe'n ef isa, 11 yn marvilus ev a dhiskwedhas travoltya 12 pub onan ynter an ment ha'n penn an kass,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 ché da le reni era tornato ’l volto, 14 e in dietro venir li convenia, 15 perché ’l veder dinanzi era lor tolto.
query.error: **English:** 13 for their face was turned from their loins, 14 and they had to come backwards, 15 because they were prevented from seeing in front of them.
query.result: 13 rag an reni o veu troys an golwg, 14 ha dhe'n golwg dhe'n ef o veu dheuth, 15 rag an gweles dhe'n ef o veu kemeres dhe'n ef.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 Forse per forza già di parlasia 17 si travolse così alcun del tutto; 18 ma io nol vidi, né credo che sia.
query.error: **English:** 16 Perhaps by force of paralysis already 17 some were overthrown completely; 18 but I did not see it, nor do I believe it is so.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 Se Dio ti lasci, lettor, prender frutto 20 di tua lezione, or pensa per te stesso 21 com’ io potea tener lo viso asciutto,
query.error: **English:** 19 If God lets you, reader, take fruit 20 from your lesson, now think for yourself 21 how I could keep my face dry,
query.result: 19 Mar les Duw, lenor, kemer ffrwyth 20 a'ga lesownek, mes pansewgh ragthon 21 pyth vythallen vyth wylas owth sek,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 quando la nostra imagine di presso 23 vidi sì torta, che ’l pianto de li occhi 24 le natiche bagnava per lo fesso.
query.error: **English:** 22 when I saw our image so twisted nearby, 23 that the tears from my eyes 24 bathed its buttocks through the crack.
query.result: 22 pan welyv owr ymageth a-ugh 23 ow torrys vyth, an gwelasow owth lyga 24 ow bys owth fenowgh rag an fessow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 Certo io piangea, poggiato a un de’ rocchi 26 del duro scoglio, sì che la mia scorta 27 mi disse: «Ancor se’ tu de li altri sciocchi?
query.error: **English:** 25 Certainly I wept, leaning against one of the rocks 26 of the hard cliff, so that my guide 27 said to me: "Are you still one of the other fools?
query.result: 25 Sur, yth wethav, ow tos dhe unn a'n garrek 26 a'n garrek kalet, marow byth ow thaswar 27 a leveris: "A wra tos unn a'n erel sciocchi?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 Qui vive la pietà quand’ è ben morta; 29 chi è più scellerato che colui 30 che al giudicio divin passion comporta?
query.error: **English:** 28 Here lives pity when it is well and truly dead; 29 who is more wicked than he 30 who endures suffering in the divine judgment?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 Drizza la testa, drizza, e vedi a cui 32 s’aperse a li occhi d’i Teban la terra; 33 per ch’ei gridavan tutti: “Dove rui,
query.error: **English:** 31 Raise your head, raise it, and see to whom 32 the earth opened up before the eyes of the Thebans; 33 because of which they all cried out: "Where are you rushing,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 Anfïarao? perché lasci la guerra?”. 35 E non restò di ruinare a valle 36 fino a Minòs che ciascheduno afferra.
query.error: **English:** 34 Amphiaraus? Why do you leave the war?". 35 And he did not stop falling down into the valley 36 until Minos, who seizes everyone.
query.result: 34 Amphiaraus? Rag ow thue an vresel?". 35 Ha na wostas a rui dhe'n glyn 36 bys dhe Minos a wra dhe gemeras oll.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 Mira c’ha fatto petto de le spalle; 38 perché volle veder troppo davante, 39 di retro guarda e fa retroso calle.
query.error: **English:** 37 See how he has made a breast of his shoulders; 38 because he wanted to see too far ahead, 39 he looks behind and goes backwards.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 Vedi Tiresia, che mutò sembiante 41 quando di maschio femmina divenne, 42 cangiandosi le membra tutte quante;
query.error: **English:** 40 See Tiresias, who changed appearance 41 when from male he became female, 42 changing all of his members;
query.result: 40 Gwel Tiresias, a wrug y semlant 41 pan a wra gwryw yn benen, 42 ow chanjya y oll y esel oll.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 e prima, poi, ribatter li convenne 44 li duo serpenti avvolti, con la verga, 45 che rïavesse le maschili penne.
query.error: **English:** 43 and first, then, he had to strike again 44 the two entwined serpents, with the rod, 45 so that he could have his male parts back.
query.result: 43 Ha kyns, wosa, yth o ev dhe wrug 44 an dhew serpens ow tos ow kolji, gans an verga, 45 rag ev a wra kavos y benen gwryw.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 Aronta è quel ch’al ventre li s’atterga, 47 che ne’ monti di Luni, dove ronca 48 lo Carrarese che di sotto alberga,
query.error: **English:** 46 Aronta is he who clings to his belly, 47 who in the mountains of Luni, where the quarryman 48 from Carrara who lives below works,
query.result: 46 Aronta yw an neb a wrasi dhe golon, 47 a wra yn menydhyow Luni, le may Carrarese 48 a wra ow tos ow erberi a-woles,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 ebbe tra ’ bianchi marmi la spelonca 50 per sua dimora; onde a guardar le stelle 51 e ’l mar non li era la veduta tronca.
query.error: **English:** 49 had his cave among the white marble 50 as his dwelling; from where his view of the stars 51 and the sea was not obstructed.
query.result: 49 a wra y gav y spelonca ynter an marbil gwynn 50 rag y jynna; ow tos gwel an steren 51 ha'n mor na wra y welas tronca.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 E quella che ricuopre le mammelle, 53 che tu non vedi, con le trecce sciolte, 54 e ha di là ogne pilosa pelle,
query.error: **English:** 52 And she who covers her breasts, 53 which you do not see, with her hair flowing loose, 54 and has every hair of her skin plucked out,
query.result: 52 Ha henna a wra kovr an bronnow, 53 henna na welowgh, gans an blew skynnys, 54 ha pub onan blew a'y hoel,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 Poscia che ’l padre suo di vita uscìo 59 e venne serva la città di Baco, 60 questa gran tempo per lo mondo gio.
query.error: **English:** 58 After his father departed from life 59 and the city of Bacchus became a servant, 60 this [city] rejoiced for a long time throughout the world.
query.result: 58 Wosa y das y dasvyth a vewnas 59 ha deuth servas an cita Baco, 60 an cita ma a wria bys vyth dres an bys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 Suso in Italia bella giace un laco, 62 a piè de l’Alpe che serra Lamagna 63 sovra Tiralli, c’ha nome Benaco.
query.error: **English:** 61 Up in beautiful Italy lies a lake, 62 at the foot of the Alps that enclose Germany, 63 above Tyrol, whose name is Benaco.
query.result: 61 Yn Utel yn Itali a-ves lagh, 62 a-woles an Alpow a ser Laghman, 63 a-ugh Tiralli, henwys Benaco.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 Per mille fonti, credo, e più si bagna 65 tra Garda e Val Camonica e Pennino 66 de l’acqua che nel detto laco stagna.
query.error: **English:** 64 By a thousand springs, I believe, and more it is fed 65 between Garda and Val Camonica and Pennine, 66 from the water that stagnates in the said lake.
query.result: 64 Gans mil furneth, kredis, ha moy a-ygh, 65 ynter Garda ha Val Camonica ha Pennino, 66 a’n dowr a sow yn an lagh henwys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 Loco è nel mezzo là dove ’l trentino 68 pastore e quel di Brescia e ’l veronese 69 segnar poria, s’e’ fesse quel cammino.
query.error: **English:** 67 There is a place in the middle where the Trentino, 68 the shepherd of Brescia and the Veronese 69 could point to, if they made that journey.
query.result: 67 Le mayth yw yn kres, le mayth an Trentino, 68 an baster a Vresci ha’n Veronese 69 a alla bos, mar keffras an fordh na.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 Siede Peschiera, bello e forte arnese 71 da fronteggiar Bresciani e Bergamaschi, 72 ove la riva ’ntorno più discese.
query.error: **English:** 70 Peschiera sits, a beautiful and strong fortress, 71 to confront the Brescians and Bergamasques, 72 where the shore descends most steeply.
query.result: 70 Peschiera a-sith, kastel brav ha delhek, 71 rag styr an Vresci ha’n Vergamaschi, 72 le mayth an glann a-ugh an moyha diskenn.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 Ivi convien che tutto quanto caschi 74 ciò che ’n grembo a Benaco star non può, 75 e fassi fiume giù per verdi paschi.
query.error: **English:** 73 There it is necessary that everything falls 74 that cannot stay in the lap of Benaco, 75 and becomes a river down through green pastures.
query.result: 73 Eno rag tasom bos pub travia 74 an peth na wra Benaco gallos pows, 75 ha bos avon a-ugh an pascow gwyrdh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 Tosto che l’acqua a correr mette co, 77 non più Benaco, ma Mencio si chiama 78 fino a Governol, dove cade in Po.
query.error: **English:** 76 As soon as the water begins to flow, 77 it is no longer called Benaco, but Mincio, 78 as far as Governolo, where it falls into the Po.
query.result: 76 Kyns ages an dowr a-dhalleth resek, 77 nyns yw Benaco moy, mes Mencio an hanow, 78 bys dhe Governol, le mayth a-ugh yn Po.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 Non molto ha corso, ch’el trova una lama, 80 ne la qual si distende e la ’mpaluda; 81 e suol di state talor essere grama.
query.error: **English:** 79 It has not flowed far before it finds a marsh, 80 in which it spreads out and becomes a swamp; 81 and in summer it is sometimes harmful.
query.result: 79 Nyns yw hir an fordh kyns ages an kever, 80 ynno an kever a-ugh an dowr a ledy, 81 ha’n hav an dowr a wra drog yn fenowgh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 Quindi passando la vergine cruda 83 vide terra, nel mezzo del pantano, 84 sanza coltura e d’abitanti nuda.
query.error: **English:** 82 Then, passing by, the cruel maiden 83 saw land, in the middle of the marsh, 84 uncultivated and bare of inhabitants.
query.result: 82 Wosa tremena an vorwyn krudhel, 83 hi a welas tir, yn kres an kever, 84 heb colji ha heb trigoryon nowydh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
85 Lì, per fuggire ogne consorzio umano, 86 ristette con suoi servi a far sue arti, 87 e visse, e vi lasciò suo corpo vano.
query.error: **English:** 85 There, to flee all human company, 86 she stopped with her servants to practice her arts, 87 and lived, and left her mortal body there.
query.result: 85 Eno, rag skonya pub kethrans dhynner, 86 hi a sevis orth rag ober aga artow, 87 ha bewa, ha hi a wrug aga korf marow eno.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 Li uomini poi che ’ntorno erano sparti 89 s’accolsero a quel loco, ch’era forte 90 per lo pantan ch’avea da tutte parti.
query.error: **English:** 88 The men who were scattered around 89 gathered at that place, which was strong 90 because of the marsh that surrounded it on all sides.
query.result: 88 An dus ow thera a-dro dhe sparja, 89 a junyas orth dhe’n le mayth na, ow a-ves kresek, 90 rag an kever a-ves a pub tu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 Fer la città sovra quell’ ossa morte; 92 e per colei che ’l loco prima elesse, 93 Mantüa l’appellar sanz’ altra sorte.
query.error: **English:** 91 To make the city over those dead bones; 92 and for her who first chose the place, 93 Mantua they shall call it, without other fate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
94 Già fuor le genti sue dentro più spesse, 95 prima che la mattia da Casalodi 96 da Pinamonte inganno ricevesse.
query.error: **English:** 94 Already his people were spread out more thickly, 95 before the madness from Casalodi 96 received deceit from Pinamonte.
query.result: 94 Yn lemmyn o an dus o nessa moyha, 95 kyns an folens a Gasalodi 96 a resevis govyans a Binamonte.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 Però t’assenno che, se tu mai odi 98 originar la mia terra altrimenti, 99 la verità nulla menzogna frodi».
query.error: **English:** 97 Therefore be assured that if you ever hear 98 the origin of my land told differently, 99 the truth is not deceived by any lie.
query.result: 97 Rag henna hemma sur, genesi whelas 98 an kever an origin a'ga theroth yn dalleth, 99 an wirionedh nyns yw govethys gans neb govyans.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 E io: «Maestro, i tuoi ragionamenti 101 mi son sì certi e prendon sì mia fede, 102 che li altri mi sarien carboni spenti.
query.error: **English:** 100 And I: "Master, your reasonings 101 are so certain to me and so take my faith, 102 that the others would be like dead coals to me.
query.result: 100 Ha my: "Mester, dha resonyow 101 yw kens sur ha kemer dha feyth vy, 102 may an re erel a vyth colonnow marow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 Ma dimmi, de la gente che procede, 104 se tu ne vedi alcun degno di nota; 105 ché solo a ciò la mia mente rifiede».
query.error: **English:** 103 But tell me, of the people who are coming, 104 if you see any worthy of note; 105 for my mind turns only to that.
query.result: 103 Mes dywedh vy, a'n dus a wra, 104 genesi whelas neb onan dybryes, 105 rag henna hep an vyth spyrys a wra.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 Allor mi disse: «Quel che da la gota 107 porge la barba in su le spalle brune, 108 fu—quando Grecia fu di maschi vòta,

query.result: 106 Anedhes ev a leveris vy: "An hini a'n gota 107 a wra y varv war y skovarnyow brun, 108 o — pan vsa Gres yn voes a dus wodhes,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 sì ch’a pena rimaser per le cune— 110 augure, e diede ’l punto con Calcanta 111 in Aulide a tagliar la prima fune.
query.error: **English:** 109 so that scarcely any remained for the cradles— 110 an augur, and he gave the signal with Calchas 111 in Aulis to cut the first rope.
query.result: 109 byttegens na vynnas marnas rag an cunow— 110 o o augur, ha ev a ro's an poynt gans Galgas 111 yn Aulid rag tronki an kynsa korden.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 Euripilo ebbe nome, e così ’l canta 113 l’alta mia tragedìa in alcun loco: 114 ben lo sai tu che la sai tutta quanta.
query.error: **English:** 112 Eurypylus was his name, and thus my 113 lofty tragedy sings of him in some place: 114 you know it well, for you know it all.
query.result: 112 Evripilos o o hanow, ha felly 113 yma kan an vyth drojyk ughella 114 yn nebes le: ty a wra vyth preder.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 Quell’ altro che ne’ fianchi è così poco, 116 Michele Scotto fu, che veramente 117 de le magiche frode seppe ’l gioco.
query.error: **English:** 115 That other one who is so small in the flanks, 116 was Michael Scot, who truly 117 knew the game of magical deceptions.
query.result: 115 An hini aral a wra mor lyha yn y flanken, 116 Mikael Skot o o, neb a wydh yn wir 117 a-dro dhe'n gwariow hudhek.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 Vedi Guido Bonatti; vedi Asdente, 119 ch’avere inteso al cuoio e a lo spago 120 ora vorrebbe, ma tardi si pente.
query.error: **English:** 118 See Guido Bonatti; see Asdente, 119 who would now like to have understood the leather and the cord, 120 but repents too late.
query.result: 118 Gwel Guido Bonatti; gwel Asdente, 119 neb a garas komprehendya an kowr ha'n korden 120 a vynnas lemmyn, mes re dhewedh dhesempys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 Vedi le triste che lasciaron l’ago, 122 la spuola e ’l fuso, e fecersi ’ndivine; 123 fecer malie con erbe e con imago.
query.error: **English:** 121 See the wretched women who abandoned the needle, 122 the spool and the spindle, and made themselves into witches; 123 they made spells with herbs and with images.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 Ma vienne omai, ché già tiene ’l confine 125 d’amendue li emisperi e tocca l’onda 126 sotto Sobilia Caino e le spine;
query.error: **English:** 124 But now let us come, for it already holds the boundary 125 of both hemispheres and touches the waves 126 beneath Seville, Cain and the thorns;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 e già iernotte fu la luna tonda: 128 ben ten de’ ricordar, ché non ti nocque 129 alcuna volta per la selva fonda».
query.error: **English:** 127 and already last night the moon was full: 128 you must remember it well, for it did not harm you 129 at any time through the deep forest.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 Sì mi parlava, e andavamo introcque.
query.error: **English:** 130 Thus he spoke to me, and we went on our way together.
query.result: 130 Vel dh’y leverel, ha ni a veu kerdhys gans.
